edu.umaryland.igs.idea
Class StandardFileParameter

java.lang.Object
  edu.umaryland.igs.idea.Parameter
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.FileParameter
          edu.umaryland.igs.idea.StandardFileParameter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class StandardFileParameter
extends FileParameter

StandardFileParameter represents a filename parameter which allows the user to choose among default choices or enter a new one. StandardFileParameter overrides FileParameter to replace the text area with an editable combo box.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2006, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan
See Also:
Serialized Form

(package private)  class StandardFileParameter.VerifyingComboBox
          Starting in IDEA 2.3, StandardFileParameter's choices combo box is an instance of VerifyingComboBox, which extends JComboBox to validate a user's input before allowing it to be selected on the combo box.

public StandardFileParameter(String n,

initializeComboBoxInputVerifier

private void initializeComboBoxInputVerifier()
The initializeComboBoxInputVerifier method adds an input verifier to the combo box's internal text field (the one seen on the screen) which calls any input verifier currently set for the textField member inherited from class Parameter, which is not displayed for a StandardFileParameter.

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
The setEnabled overrides the method in class FileParameter to disable the combo box.

Overrides:
setEnabled in class FileParameter
Parameters:
enabled - whether the parameter should be enabled

entryArea

public JPanel entryArea(int minimumNameLength)
The entryArea method returns a GUI component that displays the name of the parameter and, if available, an explanation of its interpretation and allows the user to enter a value. This overrides the superclass method to pair the file chooser with a combo box instead of a text field. Callers of this method supply a minimumNameLength parameter obtained from a ParameterSet containing this parameter.

Overrides:
entryArea in class FileParameter
Parameters:
minimumNameLength - the text label length, based on the maximum length among names in the parameter set
Returns:
a JPanel component to add to the GUI

readObject

private void readObject(ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws IOException,
                        ClassNotFoundException
The readObject method has the exact signature required for Java serialization, although serialization is actually performed using the third-party XStream library. Parameters require custom serialization because the action and focus listeners which update their values based on user input to the GUI are not fields of the objects they listen on and thus are not automatically restored during deserialization, so they must be restored explicitly to ensure that parameter changes the user makes after loading a saved configuration are honored. Since the addActionListener method modifies the actionListeners field, a copy must be used here to avoid a ConcurrentModificationException. After adding the listeners to the GUI components using addActionListener, the actionListeners parameter is reset to the copy so it will not contain duplicates. NOTE: This method is identical for class Parameter and all its subclasses, but because it is required to be private, it has been copied into each subclass.

Parameters:
in - the input stream from which to read this parameter
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs during deserialization
ClassNotFoundException - if a class in the hierarchy of the deserialized parameter is unrecognized
